main event: On November 7, 1951, a UFO sighting was reported over Montreal, Canada. The object was observed to be oval in shape, silvery in color, and moved at high speed before disappearing from view in a matter of seconds.
interesting points: The witness observed the UFO for a period of 10-15 seconds as it moved from north to south at an estimated altitude of 10,000 feet.
No sound was heard from the object, and its movement appeared to be smooth and without erratic maneuvers.
The object emitted a bright light and seemed to be rotating, and was estimated to be about 60 to 70 feet in diameter.
The witness, a former Army Officer with experience in observing conventional aircraft, confirmed that the object was unlike any known aircraft.
Several competent and well-qualified observers reported the sighting, and their characters were described as beyond reproach.
sighted object: oval, silvery object moving at high speed
